Authors:
Guillermo Morera, Sandra Lupo, Sandra Maria Alaniz, Gerardo
Lucio Robledo
Title:
A synopsis of Ganoderma genus in Uruguay: contributions on
diversity and taxa delimitation in neotropical Ganoderma species
Abstract:
Abstract Ganoderma is a cosmopolitan genus that includes a
great diversity of species. Many of them have been historically
described, but due to their morphological plasticity there is no
complete understanding about their relationship and taxonomic status.
Commonly applied names, particularly in the southern Neotropics, come
from species of north-hemisphere distribution (i.e.: G. lucidum, G.
resinaceum and G. applanatum). The aim of this work was to determine the
diversity of the Ganoderma genus in Uruguay through ITS-based
phylogenies in combination with morphological, ecological and
distribution data. The results confirm the presence of 4 reddish laccate
species (G. dorsale, G. platense, G. martinicense and G. mexicanum) and
2 opaque species (G. australe s.l.). The species are morphologically
differentiated mainly by its stipe, pilear surface, context, pores,
basidiospores and cutis cells. Regarding the ecological data, the
species present differences in substrate preferences. In addition, a
comprehensive taxonomic discussion regarding phylogenetical position and
taxonomic status is presented.
